panels.description:
watch the sas-readiness container to see when viya begins starting up (container exists but ready=0), and viya startup complete (ready=1)

also including container restarts in this graph

targets.expr: sum by (container,pod) (kube_pod_container_status_ready{namespace=~"$namespace", container="sas-readiness"})
increase(kube_pod_container_status_restarts_total{job="kube-state-metrics", namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container=~"$container"}[1m])

panels.title: Is Viya Up?

panels.description: Pod replicas "scheduled" lags behind "desired" due to node startup time (this is normal).

targets.expr:
# HPA pod replicas desired ({{namespace}})
sum by(namespace) (kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_status_current_replicas{namespace=~"$namespace"})

# HPA pod replicas ready ({{namespace}})
sum by(namespace) (kube_deployment_status_replicas_available{
    namespace=~"$namespace"
  , deployment=~"$pod"
  , deployment!="sas-opendistro-operator"
  , deployment!="sas-readiness"
  , deployment!="sas-prepull"
  , deployment!="sas-data-server-utility"
  , deployment!="sas-connect-spawner"
  , deployment!~"sas-crunchy-data-postgres.*"
  , deployment!="sas-connect-spawner"
  , deployment!="sas-config-reconciler"
  , deployment!="sas-cas-operator"
  , deployment!="prometheus-pushgateway"
  , deployment!="sas-data-server-operator"
})

# nodepool: {{label_agentpool}}
(sum by (label_agentpool) (kube_node_labels{node=~"$Node", node=~".*$NodeClass.*"}))

# Total "Ready" Nodes
sum by (status) (kube_node_status_condition{condition="Ready", status="true"})

panels.title: Autoscaling (Pods & Nodes)

panels.description: If container xyz is hitting 100% of its CPU request, then it's a performance bottleneck. Increase its request (and possibly the size of the node it is on) and it should run faster.

targets.expr:
( 100 * (
sum by(pod,container) (irate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{node=~"$Node", container!="", pod!~".*prepull.*", job="kubelet", namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container=~"$container", container!="POD", image!=""}[4m])) 
/ 
sum by(pod,container) (kube_pod_container_resource_requests{node=~"$Node", container!="", pod!~".*prepull.*", job="kube-state-metrics", resource="cpu", namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container=~"$container"}) 
))

panels.title: Container CPU (% of request)

targets.expr:
(100*(
  sum by(pod,container) (irate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total {node=~"$Node", container!="", pod!~".*prepull.*", namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container=~"$container", container="sas-programming-environment", job="kubelet", container!="POD", image!=""}[4m])) 
/ sum by(pod,container) (      kube_pod_container_resource_limits{node=~"$Node", container!="", pod!~".*prepull.*", namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container=~"$container", container="sas-programming-environment", job="kube-state-metrics", resource="cpu"  }    )
))

sum by (nodename) (
  (1 - rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{job="node-exporter", mode="idle", nodename=~"$Node", nodename=~".*$NodeClass.*"}[$__rate_interval]))
/ ignoring(cpu) group_left
  count without (cpu)( node_cpu_seconds_total{job="node-exporter", mode="idle", nodename=~"$Node", nodename=~".*$NodeClass.*"})
)

sum by (nodename,device) (rate(node_network_receive_bytes_total{job="node-exporter", nodename=~"$Node", nodename=~".*$NodeClass.*", device!="lo", device!~"veth.*", device!~"en.*"}[$__rate_interval]) )

sum by (nodename,device) (rate(node_network_transmit_bytes_total{job="node-exporter", nodename=~"$Node", nodename=~".*$NodeClass.*", device!="lo", device!~"veth.*", device!~"en.*"}[$__rate_interval]) )

( 100 * (
sum by(pod,container) (container_memory_rss{node=~"$Node", container!="", pod!~".*prepull.*", job="kubelet", namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container=~"$container", container!="POD"}) 
/ 
sum by(pod,container) (kube_pod_container_resource_requests{node=~"$Node", container!="", pod!~".*prepull.*", job="kube-state-metrics", resource="memory", namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container=~"$container" }) 
))

panels.description: If near 100% then processes in the container are at risk of OutOfMemory exception

targets.expr:
( 100 * (
sum by(pod,container) (container_memory_rss{node=~"$Node", container!="", pod!~".*prepull.*", job="kubelet", namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container=~"$container", container!="POD"}) 
/ 
sum by(pod,container) (kube_pod_container_resource_limits{node=~"$Node", container!="", pod!~".*prepull.*", job="kube-state-metrics", resource="memory", namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container=~"$container" }) 
))

panels.title: Container Memory (rss) (% of limit)

panels.description: rss +  dirty pages (in cache but not safe to reclaim / flush from mem due to not yet being written to disk)
panels.title: Node Memory Util (rss+dirty)

targets.expr: sum(rate(node_disk_read_bytes_total{nodename=~"$Node", nodename=~".*$NodeClass.*"}[1m])) by (nodename,device)
sum(rate(node_disk_written_bytes_total{nodename=~"$Node", nodename=~".*$NodeClass.*"}[1m])) by (nodename,device)

panels.description: This panel is useful for seeing how long it takes SAS Viya pods to progress during startup to all pods reaching ContainerReady=true

targets.expr: count by (namespace) (kube_pod_container_status_ready{namespace=~"$namespace"})
sum by (namespace) (kube_pod_container_status_ready{namespace=~"$namespace"})
sum by (namespace) (kube_pod_container_status_waiting{namespace=~"$namespace"})
count by (namespace) (kube_pod_init_container_status_ready{namespace=~"$namespace"})
sum by (namespace) (kube_pod_init_container_status_ready{namespace=~"$namespace"})
sum by (namespace) (kube_pod_init_container_status_waiting{namespace=~"$namespace"})

sum by(namespace) (kube_pod_container_status_ready{namespace=~"$namespace"
  , container!="sas-opendistro-operator"
  , container!="sas-readiness"
  , container!="sas-prepull"
  , container!="sas-data-server-utility"
  , container!="sas-connect-spawner"
  , container!~"sas-crunchy-data-postgres.*"
  , container!="sas-connect-spawner"
  , container!="sas-config-reconciler"
  , container!="sas-cas-operator"
  , container!="prometheus-pushgateway"
  , container!="sas-data-server-operator"})

panels.title: Container Status Count by Namespace

panels.description:
Two metrics in one graph, both about "storage use":

1. node local storage like ext4, xfs
excluding tmpfs & fuse.lxcfs
Also, switching from filesystem size-available to size-free because this is what df outputs (since freebytes = availbytes + rootreserved, and rootreserved is not really available to users).

2. PVC usage. Warning: PVCs provisioned from Azure NFS server show total NFS server "/export" LUN capacity and usage percentages for each PVC, instead of the actual size and usage of each distinct PVC... Not sure (yet) how to get the actual accurate PVC usage metrics.
panels.title: Node Disk & PVC Storage Use %

targets.expr:
( 100 * (
sum by(pod,container) (container_memory_usage_bytes{node=~"$Node", container!="", pod!~".*prepull.*", job="kubelet", namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container=~"$container", container!="POD"}) 
/ 
sum by(pod,container) (kube_pod_container_resource_requests{node=~"$Node", container!="", pod!~".*prepull.*", job="kube-state-metrics", resource="memory", namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container=~"$container" }) 
))

panels.description: If near 100% then processes in the container are at risk of OutOfMemory exception

targets.expr:
( 100 * (
sum by(pod,container) (container_memory_usage_bytes{node=~"$Node", container!="", pod!~".*prepull.*", job="kubelet", namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container=~"$container", container!="POD"}) 
/ 
sum by(pod,container) (kube_pod_container_resource_limits{node=~"$Node", container!="", pod!~".*prepull.*", job="kube-state-metrics", resource="memory", namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container=~"$container" }) 
))

panels.title: Container Memory (tot)  (% of limit)

panels.description: memory use (including filecache) which can easily  reach 100% due to natural caching of any files opened in order to speed up any subsequent re-open.
panels.title: Node Memory Util (tot)

targets.expr:
#{{cas_server}}, {{pod}}, {{container}}, {{service}}, {{endpoint}}, {{instance}}
(cas_grid_sessions_current{namespace=~"$namespace",service=~".+-client"})

sum by (nodename) (
  (1 - rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{job="node-exporter", mode="idle", nodename=~"$Node", nodename=~".*$NodeClass.*"}[$__rate_interval]))
/ ignoring(cpu) group_left
  count without (cpu)( node_cpu_seconds_total{job="node-exporter", mode="idle", nodename=~"$Node", nodename=~".*$NodeClass.*"})
)

panels.description: rss +  dirty only, filecache not included. dirty is kind of like lazy write bytes that not yet been written to disk so its not safe to flush them out of filecache yet.

targets.expr:
# graph1: total-available ~= memrss            ... ((total-available)+dirtypages) = memrss+dirtypages
# graph2: total-free      ~= memrss+cached+buffers  ... ((total-free)+dirtypages) = memrss+dirtypages+cached+buffers
( (node_memory_MemTotal_bytes{nodename=~"$Node", nodename=~".*$NodeClass.*"}-node_memory_MemAvailable_bytes{nodename=~"$Node", nodename=~".*$NodeClass.*"}) + node_memory_Dirty_bytes{nodename=~"$Node", nodename=~".*$NodeClass.*"})
/ node_memory_MemTotal_bytes{nodename=~"$Node", nodename=~".*$NodeClass.*"}

panels.title: Node Memory Util (rss+dirty)

targets.expr:
# available - free = cached... fixing by changing this "total mem use (rss+cache)" to just MemAvailable
# graph1: total-available ~= memrss            ... ((total-available)+dirtypages) = memrss+dirtypages
# graph2: total-free      ~= memrss+cached+buffers
( (node_memory_MemTotal_bytes{nodename=~"$Node", nodename=~".*$NodeClass.*"}-node_memory_MemFree_bytes{nodename=~"$Node", nodename=~".*$NodeClass.*"}) )
/ node_memory_MemTotal_bytes{nodename=~"$Node", nodename=~".*$NodeClass.*"}

panels.description: user+nice cpu time
panels.title: Node CPU Utilization (user+nice)

panels.description: system+irq+softirq

targets.expr:
(   sum by(nodename) ( irate( node_cpu_seconds_total{nodename=~"$Node", nodename=~".*$NodeClass.*",mode="system"}[1m] ) ) 
  + sum by(nodename) ( irate( node_cpu_seconds_total{nodename=~"$Node", nodename=~".*$NodeClass.*", mode="irq"}[1m] ) )
  + sum by(nodename) ( irate( node_cpu_seconds_total{nodename=~"$Node", nodename=~".*$NodeClass.*", mode="softirq"}[1m] ) )
) / sum(irate(node_cpu_seconds_total[1m])) by(nodename)

panels.title: Node CPU Utilization (system)

targets.expr:
(   sum by(nodename) ( irate( node_cpu_seconds_total{nodename=~"$Node", nodename=~".*$NodeClass.*",mode="iowait"}[1m] ) ) 
) / sum(irate(node_cpu_seconds_total[1m])) by(nodename)

sum by(pod,container) (irate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{node=~"$Node", container!="", pod!~".*prepull.*", job="kubelet", namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container=~"$container", container!="POD", image!=""}[4m]))

sum by(pod,container) (container_memory_rss{node=~"$Node", job="kubelet", namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", pod!~".*prepull.*", container=~"$container", container!="", container!="POD", container!=""})

sum by(pod,container) (container_memory_usage_bytes{node=~"$Node", job="kubelet", namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", pod!~".*prepull.*", container=~"$container", container!="", container!="POD", container!=""})

( 100 * (
sum by(pod,container) (irate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{node=~"$Node", container!="", pod!~".*prepull.*", job="kubelet", namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container=~"$container", container!="POD", image!=""}[4m])) 
/ 
sum by(pod,container) (kube_pod_container_resource_requests{node=~"$Node", container!="", pod!~".*prepull.*", job="kube-state-metrics", resource="cpu", namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container=~"$container"}) 
))

panels.title: Container CPU use as a % of request

targets.expr:
( 100 * (
sum by(pod,container) (container_memory_rss{node=~"$Node", container!="", pod!~".*prepull.*", job="kubelet", namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container=~"$container", container!="POD"}) 
/ 
sum by(pod,container) (kube_pod_container_resource_requests{node=~"$Node", container!="", pod!~".*prepull.*", job="kube-state-metrics", resource="memory", namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container=~"$container" }) 
))

panels.title: Container Memory use (rss) as a % of request

targets.expr:
( 100 * (
sum by(pod,container) (container_memory_usage_bytes{node=~"$Node", container!="", pod!~".*prepull.*", job="kubelet", namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container=~"$container", container!="POD"}) 
/ 
sum by(pod,container) (kube_pod_container_resource_requests{node=~"$Node", container!="", pod!~".*prepull.*", job="kube-state-metrics", resource="memory", namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container=~"$container" }) 
))

panels.title: Container Memory use (tot) as a % of request

targets.expr:
( 100 * (
sum by(pod,container) (irate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{node=~"$Node", container!="", pod!~".*prepull.*", job="kubelet", namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container=~"$container", container!="POD", image!=""}[4m])) 
/ 
sum by(pod,container) (kube_pod_container_resource_limits{node=~"$Node", container!="", pod!~".*prepull.*", job="kube-state-metrics", resource="cpu", namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container=~"$container"}) 
))

/ 
sum by(pod,container) (kube_pod_container_resource_limits{node=~"$Node", container!="", pod!~".*prepull.*", job="kube-state-metrics", resource="memory", namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container=~"$container" }) 
))

targets.expr:

sum by(pod,container) (container_memory_usage_bytes{node=~"$Node", container!="", pod!~".*prepull.*", job="kubelet", namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container=~"$container", container!="POD"}) 
/ 
sum by(pod,container) (kube_pod_container_resource_limits{node=~"$Node", container!="", pod!~".*prepull.*", job="kube-state-metrics", resource="memory", namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container=~"$container" }) 
))

panels.title: Container Memory use (tot) as a % of limit

targets.expr: sum by (nodename,device) (rate(node_network_receive_bytes_total{job="node-exporter", nodename=~"$Node", nodename=~".*$NodeClass.*", device!="lo", device!~"veth.*"}[$__rate_interval]) )
sum by (nodename,device) (rate(node_network_transmit_bytes_total{job="node-exporter", nodename=~"$Node", nodename=~".*$NodeClass.*", device!="lo", device!~"veth.*"}[$__rate_interval]) )
sum by (node,device) (irate(container_network_receive_packets_total{node=~"$Node", node=~".*$NodeClass.*", namespace="", interface!="lo", interface!~"veth.*"}[$__rate_interval]) )
(irate(container_network_transmit_packets_total{node=~"$Node", node=~".*$NodeClass.*", namespace="", interface!="lo", interface!~"veth.*"}[$__rate_interval]) )
sum(rate(node_disk_read_bytes_total{nodename=~"$Node", nodename=~".*$NodeClass.*"}[1m])) by (nodename,device)
sum(rate(node_disk_written_bytes_total{nodename=~"$Node", nodename=~".*$NodeClass.*"}[1m])) by (nodename,device)
rate(node_disk_reads_completed_total{nodename=~"$Node", nodename=~".*$NodeClass.*"}[1m])
rate(node_disk_writes_completed_total{nodename=~"$Node", nodename=~".*$NodeClass.*"}[1m])
node_sockstat_sockets_used{nodename=~"$Node", nodename=~".*$NodeClass.*"}
node_sockstat_TCP_alloc{nodename=~"$Node", nodename=~".*$NodeClass.*"}
node_sockstat_TCP_inuse{nodename=~"$Node", nodename=~".*$NodeClass.*"}
node_sockstat_TCP_tw{nodename=~"$Node", nodename=~".*$NodeClass.*"}
node_netstat_Tcp_CurrEstab{nodename=~"$Node", nodename=~".*$NodeClass.*"}

Node local storage (e.g. ext4, xfs, etc.) excluding tmpfs & fuse.lxcfs

Uses (filesystem size-free) to be comparable to Linux df outputs.

panels.description: Warning: PVCs provisioned from Azure NFS server show total NFS server "/export" LUN capacity and usage percentages for each PVC, instead of the actual size and usage of each distinct PVC

targets.expr:
( sum by (namespace) (sas_db_pool_connections{container=~"$container", pod=~"$pod", node=~"$Node"}) )
+ ( sum by (namespace) (jdbc_connections_active{container=~"$container", pod=~"$pod", node=~"$Node"}) )
pg_settings_max_connections
( sum by (namespace,sas_service_base) (sas_db_pool_connections{container=~"$container", pod=~"$pod", node=~"$Node"}) )
( sum by (namespace,sas_service_base) (jdbc_connections_active{container=~"$container", pod=~"$pod", node=~"$Node"}) )
sum by (namespace,container,sas_service_base) (sas_db_pool_connections{container=~"$container", pod=~"$pod", node=~"$Node"})
sum by (namespace,container,sas_service_base) (jdbc_connections_active{container=~"$container", pod=~"$pod", node=~"$Node"})

panels.description:
if > 80% then scaleUp 1 node ... really if any pod cant find a node to schedule to, this is what triggers scale out of a new node

if < 50% then scaleDown 1 node (for avg req allocation mem & cpu on any given node)
panels.title: ClusterAutoscaler Trigger: Average(%Request Allocated)  Per Nodepool

panels.description:
ClusterAutoscaler ScaleUp happens when at least one pod is unable to be scheduled.

ClusterAutoscaler ScaleDown happens when  node's cpu AND memory requests/capacity is below the scale-down-utilization-threshold of 50%(default), denoted by the lower blue region

targets.expr:
# This query reflects what you see from "kubectl describe node | grep 'Allocated resources' -A6
#   Divide by "allocatable" cpu or memory instead of "capacity"
#   Use the highest value for cpu request & memory req from all containers And initContainers in each pod
sum by(node)(
  max by(pod, node, resource)( 
    kube_pod_container_resource_requests       {node=~"$Node", node=~".*$NodeClass.*", resource="cpu"} or
    kube_pod_init_container_resource_requests  {node=~"$Node", node=~".*$NodeClass.*", resource="cpu"} )
) / sum by(node)( kube_node_status_allocatable {node=~"$Node", node=~".*$NodeClass.*", resource="cpu"} )

panels.title: ClusterAutoscaler Trigger: CPU %Request Allocated Per Node

panels.description:
ClusterAutoscaler ScaleUp happens when at least one pod is unable to be scheduled.

ClusterAutoscaler ScaleDown happens when  node's cpu AND memory requests/capacity is below the scale-down-utilization-threshold of 50%(default), denoted by the lower blue region

targets.expr:
# This query reflects what you see from "kubectl describe node | grep 'Allocated resources' -A6
#   Divide by "allocatable" cpu or memory instead of "capacity"
#   Use the highest value for cpu request & memory req from all containers And initContainers in each pod
sum by(node)(
  max by(pod, node, resource)( 
    kube_pod_container_resource_requests       {node=~"$Node", node=~".*$NodeClass.*", resource="memory"} or
    kube_pod_init_container_resource_requests  {node=~"$Node", node=~".*$NodeClass.*", resource="memory"} )
) / sum by(node)( kube_node_status_allocatable {node=~"$Node", node=~".*$NodeClass.*", resource="memory"} )

panels.title: ClusterAutoscaler Trigger: Mem %Request Allocated Per Node

panels.description:
ClusterAutoscaler ScaleDown should happen for any node in this table with "blue" CPU & MEM (i.e. below the scale-down-utilization-threshold of 50%(default)). For more detail -> https://github.com/kubernetes/autoscaler/blob/master/cluster-autoscaler/FAQ.md#how-does-scale-down-work

If nodes are not scaling down, then check nodes for Pods with restrictive PodDisruptionBudget, Pods that are not backed by a controller object, etc. For more detail -> https://github.com/kubernetes/autoscaler/blob/master/cluster-autoscaler/FAQ.md#what-types-of-pods-can-prevent-ca-from-removing-a-node


ClusterAutoscaler ScaleUp happens when at least one pod is unable to be scheduled. Numbers over 80% are colored red to indicate increased chance of not being able to schedule a pod on that node.

targets.expr:
# This query reflects what you see from "kubectl describe node | grep 'Allocated resources' -A6
#   Divide by "allocatable" cpu or memory instead of "capacity"
#   Use the highest value for cpu request & memory req from all containers And initContainers in each pod
sum by(node)(
  max by(pod, node, resource)( 
    kube_pod_container_resource_requests       {node=~"$Node", node=~".*$NodeClass.*", resource="cpu"} or
    kube_pod_init_container_resource_requests  {node=~"$Node", node=~".*$NodeClass.*", resource="cpu"} )
) / sum by(node)( kube_node_status_allocatable {node=~"$Node", node=~".*$NodeClass.*", resource="cpu"} )

# This query reflects what you see from "kubectl describe node | grep 'Allocated resources' -A6
#   Divide by "allocatable" cpu or memory instead of "capacity"
#   Use the highest value for cpu request & memory req from all containers And initContainers in each pod
sum by(node)(
  max by(pod, node, resource)( 
    kube_pod_container_resource_requests       {node=~"$Node", node=~".*$NodeClass.*", resource="memory"} or
    kube_pod_init_container_resource_requests  {node=~"$Node", node=~".*$NodeClass.*", resource="memory"} )
) / sum by(node)( kube_node_status_allocatable {node=~"$Node", node=~".*$NodeClass.*", resource="memory"} )

# This query reflects what you see from "kubectl describe node | grep 'Allocated resources' -A6
#   Divide by "allocatable" cpu or memory instead of "capacity"
#   Use the highest value for cpu request & memory req from all containers And initContainers in each pod
sum by(node)(
  max by(pod, node, resource)( 
    kube_pod_container_resource_requests       {node=~"$Node", node=~".*$NodeClass.*", resource="ephemeral_storage"} or
    kube_pod_init_container_resource_requests  {node=~"$Node", node=~".*$NodeClass.*", resource="ephemeral_storage"} )
) / sum by(node)( kube_node_status_allocatable {node=~"$Node", node=~".*$NodeClass.*", resource="ephemeral_storage"} )

panels.title: ClusterAutoscaler Trigger: %Request Allocated Per Node

panels.description: Watch the sas-readiness container to see when viya begins starting up (container exists but ready=0), and viya startup complete (ready=1)

targets.expr: sum by (container,pod) (kube_pod_container_status_ready{namespace=~"$namespace", container="sas-readiness"})

panels.title: Is Viya Up?

panels.description:
container restarts
(Not a "pod Terminated/restart" count)

targets.expr: increase(kube_pod_container_status_restarts_total{job="kube-state-metrics", namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container=~"$container"}[1m])

panels.title: Container Restarts

targets.expr:
# ({{service}}) > ({{endpoint}}) > ({{sas_service_base}}) > ({{node}})
process_open_fds{namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", service!=""}
process_open_fds{namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", service=""}
count( container_start_time_seconds{node=~"$Node",namespace=~"$namespace",container=~"sas-programming-environment"} )

panels.description: http requests seen from the perspective of the nginx-ingress "front door". 1 minute moving window, so each data point shows the hits/second averaged over the past 1 minute.

targets.expr:
#           sum by(exported_namespace) (    irate(nginx_ingress_controller_requests{job="ingress-nginx", exported_namespace=~"$namespace", service=~"$container"}[1m]) ) 
#clamp_max( sum by(exported_namespace) ( increase(nginx_ingress_controller_requests{job="ingress-nginx", exported_namespace=~"$namespace", service=~"$container"}[1m]) ), 10000 )
            sum by(exported_namespace) (    irate(nginx_ingress_controller_requests{job="ingress-nginx", exported_namespace=~"$namespace", service=~"$container"}[1m]) )

panels.title: nginx_ingress_controller_requests (hits/second) by namespace

panels.description:
time(podContainersReady) - time(podScheduled)

approximate "group by deployment|statefulset" by using label_replace function and handling 3 different cases
1. two random hash strings (or seq numbers) after 2nd to last dash
2. one sequence number after last dash
3. no random hash or sequence numbers

if multiple pod replicas in a deployment or statefulset, display max value

targets.expr:
# primary case: two random hashes after second to last dash at end of "base app name"
max by(podprefix) (
    label_replace( kube_pod_status_ready_time    {namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", pod=~"$container.*", pod!~"sas-readiness.*|sas-consul-server.*|sas-rabbitmq-server.*|sas-opendistro-default.*|sas-workload-orchestrator.*|sas-cas-server-.*"}, "podprefix", "$1", "pod", "^(.+)-[^-]+-[^-]+$" )
  - label_replace( kube_pod_status_scheduled_time{namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", pod=~"$container.*", pod!~"sas-readiness.*|sas-consul-server.*|sas-rabbitmq-server.*|sas-opendistro-default.*|sas-workload-orchestrator.*|sas-cas-server-.*"}, "podprefix", "$1", "pod", "^(.+)-[^-]+-[^-]+$" )
)

# special case: only sequence number at end of "base app name"
max by(podprefix) (
    label_replace( kube_pod_status_ready_time    {namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", pod=~"sas-consul-server.*|sas-rabbitmq-server.*|sas-opendistro-default.*|sas-workload-orchestrator.*|sas-cas-server-default-worker.*"}, "podprefix", "$1", "pod", "^(.+)-[^-]+$" )
  - label_replace( kube_pod_status_scheduled_time{namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", pod=~"sas-consul-server.*|sas-rabbitmq-server.*|sas-opendistro-default.*|sas-workload-orchestrator.*|sas-cas-server-default-worker.*"}, "podprefix", "$1", "pod", "^(.+)-[^-]+$" )
)

# special case: no random hashes or sequence numbers at end of "base app name"
max by(podprefix) (
    label_replace( kube_pod_status_ready_time    {namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", pod=~"sas-cas-server-.*-controller"}, "podprefix", "$1", "pod", "^(.+)$" )
  - label_replace( kube_pod_status_scheduled_time{namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", pod=~"sas-cas-server-.*-controller"}, "podprefix", "$1", "pod", "^(.+)$" )
)

panels.title: Pod Startup Time (wait+init+ready)

targets.expr: count by(node)( container_start_time_seconds{node=~"$Node",namespace=~"$namespace",container="sas-programming-environment"} )

panels.description: http requests seen from the perspective of the nginx-ingress "front door". 1 minute moving window, so each data point shows the hits/second averaged over the past 1 minute.

targets.expr:
#sum by (service,status) (    irate(nginx_ingress_controller_requests{job="ingress-nginx", exported_namespace=~"$namespace", service=~"$container"}[1m]) )
#sum by (service,path)   ( increase(nginx_ingress_controller_requests{job="ingress-nginx", exported_namespace=~"$namespace", service=~"$container"}[1m]) )
 sum by (service,path)   (    irate(nginx_ingress_controller_requests{job="ingress-nginx", exported_namespace=~"$namespace", service=~"$container"}[1m]) )

panels.title: nginx_ingress_controller_requests (hits/second) by service:endpoint

panels.description:
time(podContainersReady) - time(podScheduled)

approximate "group by deployment|statefulset" by using label_replace function and handling 3 different cases
1. two random hash strings (or seq numbers) after 2nd to last dash
2. one sequence number after last dash
3. no random hash or sequence numbers

if multiple pod replicas in a deployment or statefulset, display max value

targets.expr:
# debug
  max by(pod) ( kube_pod_status_ready_time      {namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", pod=~"$container.*", pod!~"sas-readiness.*"} )
- max by(pod) ( kube_pod_container_state_started{namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", pod=~"$container.*", pod!~"sas-readiness.*"} )

# primary case: two random hashes after second to last dash at end of "base app name"
  max by(podprefix) (label_replace( kube_pod_status_ready_time      {namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", pod=~"$container.*", pod!~"sas-readiness.*|sas-consul-server.*|sas-rabbitmq-server.*|sas-opendistro-default.*|sas-workload-orchestrator.*|sas-cas-server-.*"}, "podprefix", "$1", "pod", "^(.+)-[^-]+-[^-]+$" ) )
- max by(podprefix) (label_replace( kube_pod_container_state_started{namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", pod=~"$container.*", pod!~"sas-readiness.*|sas-consul-server.*|sas-rabbitmq-server.*|sas-opendistro-default.*|sas-workload-orchestrator.*|sas-cas-server-.*"}, "podprefix", "$1", "pod", "^(.+)-[^-]+-[^-]+$" ) )

# special case: only sequence number at end of "base app name"
  max by(podprefix) ( label_replace( kube_pod_status_ready_time      {namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", pod=~"sas-consul-server.*|sas-rabbitmq-server.*|sas-opendistro-default.*|sas-workload-orchestrator.*|sas-cas-server-default-worker.*"}, "podprefix", "$1", "pod", "^(.+)-[^-]+$" ) )
- max by(podprefix) ( label_replace( kube_pod_container_state_started{namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", pod=~"sas-consul-server.*|sas-rabbitmq-server.*|sas-opendistro-default.*|sas-workload-orchestrator.*|sas-cas-server-default-worker.*"}, "podprefix", "$1", "pod", "^(.+)-[^-]+$" ) )

# special case: no random hashes or sequence numbers at end of "base app name"
  max by(podprefix) ( label_replace( kube_pod_status_ready_time      {namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", pod=~"sas-cas-server-.*-controller"}, "podprefix", "$1", "pod", "^(.+)$" ) )
- max by(podprefix) ( label_replace( kube_pod_container_state_started{namespace=~"$namespace", pod=~"$pod", pod=~"sas-cas-server-.*-controller"}, "podprefix", "$1", "pod", "^(.+)$" ) )

panels.title: Pod Startup Time (ready)

panels.description: "desired" number of pod replicas from the perspective of the HorizontalPodAutoscaler

targets.expr:
#sum by(hpa) (kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_status_current_replicas{namespace=~"$namespace"})
sum by(horizontalpodautoscaler) (kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_status_current_replicas{namespace=~"$namespace"})

panels.title: Pod Replicas (by HPA)

panels.description: Number of pod replicas that have reached "ContainersReady" status (ie. containers in those pods have readiness probe "ready=true" and are ready to process HTTP requests).

targets.expr: sum by(deployment) (kube_deployment_status_replicas_available{namespace=~"$namespace", deployment=~"$pod"})

panels.title: Replicas (by Deployment)

panels.description: Pod replicas "scheduled" lags behind "desired" due to node startup time (this is normal).

targets.expr: sum by(namespace) (kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_status_current_replicas{namespace=~"$namespace"})

sum by(namespace) (kube_deployment_status_replicas_available{namespace=~"$namespace", deployment=~"$pod"
  , deployment!="sas-opendistro-operator"
  , deployment!="sas-readiness"
  , deployment!="sas-prepull"
  , deployment!="sas-data-server-utility"
  , deployment!="sas-connect-spawner"
  , deployment!~"sas-crunchy-data-postgres.*"
  , deployment!="sas-connect-spawner"
  , deployment!="sas-config-reconciler"
  , deployment!="sas-cas-operator"
  , deployment!="prometheus-pushgateway"
  , deployment!="sas-data-server-operator"
})
(sum by (label_agentpool) (kube_node_labels{node=~"$Node"}))
sum by (status) (kube_node_status_condition{condition="Ready", status="true"})

panels.title: Autoscaling (Pods & Nodes)
